title: Principles of Music Theory
description: In-depth analysis of music theory principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Principles of Musicology
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of musicology. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Intermediate Music History
description: Interdisciplinary approach to music history combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Applied Performance
description: Comprehensive study of performance with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Performance
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in performance. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Music Technology
description: Interdisciplinary approach to music technology combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Conducting
description: Rigorous treatment of conducting theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Special Topics in Music History
description: Interdisciplinary approach to music history combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: MUSI 324 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Music Technology
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of music technology. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: MUSI 323 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Music History
description: Comprehensive study of music history with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: MUSI 331 and senior standing or graduate status
